definition: to practice strict economy (idiom)
surname Li
strict/severe

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise

sentences.english: Austerity was a new idea at Chrysler.
sentences.chinese: 厉行节约在克莱斯勒公司是一件新鲜事。

sentences.english: We must Hooverize under such a hard condition.
sentences.chinese: 在这种艰苦情况下，我们必须厉行节约。

sentences.english: Zogby said younger people are learning to economize.
sentences.chinese: 佐格比表示，年轻人正在学习厉行节约。

sentences.english: In particular, make efforts to save, to save energy.
sentences.chinese: 尤其提出厉行节约，节省能源。

sentences.english: This is an outstanding example of strict economy.
sentences.chinese: 这是厉行节约的一个出色范例。

sentences.english: Our income has decreased and now we must practise strict economy.
sentences.chinese: 我们的收入减少了，现在我们必须厉行节约。

definition: extravagance and waste (idiom)
diligent and thrifty (idiom)
to build up the country through thrift and hard work (idiom)
hardworking, thrifty, plain, and simple (idiom)
hardworking and frugal
plain and unadorned/thrifty and simple
leading a plain, hardworking life (idiom)
"three public expenditures" of the PRC government, i.e. air travel, food and entertainment, and public vehicles
generous care but a thrifty funeral/to look after one's parents generously, but not waste money on a lavish funeral
lit. to open a water source and reduce outflow (idiom); to increase income and save on spending/to broaden the sources of income and economize on expenditure
self-restraint and devotion to public duties (idiom); selfless dedication/to serve the public interest wholeheartedly
to be industrious and frugal (idiom)
frugality makes honesty (idiom)
to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
outmoded conventions/old-fashioned ways
to advocate/to initiate/to propose/to be a proponent of (an idea or school of thought)
